messages.body:
Hi again 

Thanks for sharing all the details, this is very clear. We can definitely build a custom proofing and approval system that covers everything you’ve outlined.

The way it would work is that you, as the admin, can create a project and upload multiple design items under it. A unique shareable link will be generated for the client, and they won’t need to log in. Clients will be able to view all the assets, drop pinpoint comments or annotations on each one, and either approve or request changes for every item.

Each design item will support version control, so when you upload a new version it will be saved as V1, V2, and so on. Clients will be able to compare versions and see the full history. Once all the individual items are approved, the project can automatically be marked as fully approved, or you or the client can mark it done. Notifications will be sent to your team whenever a comment or approval is made.

At the end, or on request, the system will generate a downloadable approval report in PDF format. The report will list all items, versions, comments, timestamps, and client names.

This will run alongside your existing tools like WooCommerce and Basecamp, so you don’t need to change your current setup. It will work as an independent proofing tool, very similar to what you had with WeTransfer but fully customized to your needs and owned by you.

If this direction looks good, I can share a quick proposal with the timeline and phases for how we can roll it out.

Best regards,
Rashid

awesome! yes this sounds correct! let me know pricing and timeline and i will let you know if all sounds good and fair! also now that i think about it... i may not need that "Generate approval report" ... honestly Im thinking becuase we have never seen that so perhaps it may be overkill? you can let me know your professional thoughts and opinions though! if its not too difficult to have as a feature perhaps it does not hurt to include it still!

my only timeline restraint is that wetransfer will shut off its review & portal feature by Oct 22nd... so as long as i can have something fully functional maybe a week before that - it would allow us to learn and ensure no bugs and issues... and then begin to use that instead of wetransfer. 

so technically - the sooner the better would be amazing!

Hello again 

Got it, thanks for clarifying. I agree with you on the approval report it’s not something you’ll be using every day, but since it’s not too complicated, I think it’s worth having. It gives you a proper record if you ever need it, and if you’d like we can keep it simple in the first release and expand it later.

On the timeline, no problem at all. We can have a fully functional system ready well before October 22nd. I’ll plan to deliver it at least a a week earlier so you have time to test everything, make sure there are no issues, and transition smoothly before WeTransfer shuts down.

I’ll prepare a proposal with the phases, timeline, and pricing so you can review and we can move forward quickly.

Best regards,
Rashid
Also add 30 days free support

Hi Ronnie,

Please find attached the proposal with scope, phases, timeline, and pricing for the custom proofing and approval system. This will ensure you’re fully set up before WeTransfer shuts down.

Looking forward to your feedback so we can get started right away.

Best regards,
Rashid

Hi Ronnie,

Just to clarify, the last short message you saw was actually meant for my team as we were finalizing the proposal details for you. What I wanted to confirm there is that the package also includes 30 days of free support after delivery. That way, you’ll have peace of mind while moving everything over from WeTransfer and getting comfortable with the new system.

Best regards,
Rashid
Okay one moment. I did reach out to a couple of guys regarding this so let me compare and let you know!

Hi Ronnie,

Absolutely, take your time to compare. I’m confident in the value and timeline we’ve laid out, and I’ll be ready to move forward as soon as you give the green light so we can hit your deadline comfortably.

Best regards,
Rashid
Yes of course i know this other guy quoted me about 1385 cheaper than your quote. so that makes it a bit tough he told me $2500. i think you and him have the highest reviews and ratings.

Hi Ronnie,

I completely understand cost is always an important factor. My proposal reflects not just the development work, but also the quality, reliability, and 30 days of free support I provide after delivery. With me, there are no hidden issues and no hidden charges what I quote is what you pay, and I make sure the system works smoothly for your team.

Many clients choose me because of my track record, clear communication, and ability to deliver on time. That’s the real value behind my proposal, especially with your Oct 22nd deadline coming up.

I’d be glad to move forward whenever you’re ready.

Best regards,
Rashid

Hi Ronnie,

Just wanted to follow up regarding the proposal I shared. I understand you’re comparing options, but I wanted to check if you had any questions or needed clarification on anything.

I’m ready to get started and ensure your system is fully functional well before the Oct 22nd deadline.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

Best regards,
Rashid

okay thank you Rashid. Lets go ahead and get started i appreciate your fast responses. what all do you need from me? should i Design something in photoshop as far as how i would like it all to look and then you can code and develop it from there?

Also a few small details i wanted to make note of.. as im currently trying to design out a solid reference for you...

I would like to allow thumbnails of course. Then when they click a particular elemets thumbnail it should open that element up fully... perhaps still showing the additional elements as well in a clean way but then the "APPROVE" and "REQUEST CHANGES" buttom show with a comment box and then a "SUBMIT CHANGES" button under the comment box. 

It would be good to have a "download" option but on our backend for admin i would need the ability to NOT allow downloads for any project set. there are some cases where we may eventually lock projects and utilize them as our "design portfolio" to showcase some of our favorite designs and i do not want people being able to download client files. 

Currently you can view our current design portfolio setup here: https://we.tl/ua9U7B5QER

Hi Ronnie,

Perfect I’ll go ahead and get things started. Thanks for confirming.

A Photoshop reference or even just some simple wireframes/sketches from you will definitely help me understand your vision for the layout and flow. From there, I’ll handle coding and development to bring it to life.

The details you mentioned are clear and make sense:

Thumbnails leading to full view of each element, with “Approve” and “Request Changes” options, plus a comment box and “Submit Changes” button.

Ability to show other elements alongside the opened one in a clean layout.

Download option for clients, but with admin control to restrict/disable downloads on selected projects (for cases like your design portfolio).

I’ve also checked out your current portfolio link very helpful for context. I’ll make sure we design this system to feel intuitive while keeping your admin controls flexible.

Let me know when you have the Photoshop reference ready, and in the meantime, I’ll prepare the foundation so we’re not losing time.

Best regards,
Rashid
rshidashrf just sent you a custom offer

Hi Ronnie,

Just to clarify about the time zones  the hours I shared earlier (7 AM – 11 PM my time, which is about 10 PM – 2 PM EST) are mainly to let you know when I’m fully available for fast back-and-forth communication.

That said, please feel free to message me anytime, day or night. Even if it’s outside of those hours, I always keep my mobile with me and I’ll do my best to respond quickly. So you’ll never feel limited by the time zone difference you can reach out whenever it’s convenient for you.

Best regards,
Rashid

okay thank you. question have you had to develop a system like this before? and or do you have somethin similar that i can take a look at? Im really wanting this to be a very smooth and clean UIX so would love to see some of your references if able!

Hi Ronnie,

Great question. While every client has slightly different requirements, yes I’ve built custom review/approval and collaboration systems before. They involved features like uploading assets, versioning, comment/approval workflows, and admin controls, so I’m very familiar with the workflow you’re describing.

For example:

I built a custom approval system for 360sitevisit.com, a company that provides virtual venue tours. Their clients can review the virtual tour projects, add comments, and either approve or request changes. This system has been live and working smoothly for the past six years.


I’m also currently working with a credit repair services company. In this system, clients submit requests for credit repair, provide documents, and the agency reviews the information, performs the service, and then shares proof of the work back with the client. This one is still under development but follows a very similar workflow to what you need.

Since many of these projects are private, I can’t share the live portals directly, but I can prepare a couple of UI references and example flows (similar to what we’ll build for you) so you get a clear picture of how smooth and user-friendly the experience will be.

As you mentioned wanting a very smooth and modern UI/UX, I’ll make sure the design stays clean, intuitive, and simple for your clients to use without training. Once you send me your Photoshop reference, I’ll align everything with your vision as well.

Best regards,
Rashid
oh gotcha and you dont have screen shots of these portions? im currently trying to just get a good idea of how id like to design my interface.

Hi Ronnie,

I get it visuals make it easier. Since those systems are private, I can’t share direct screenshots, but what I can do is prepare some sample wireframes and UI references for you. That way you’ll have a clear idea of the flow and design, and once you share your Photoshop reference, I can align everything with your vision.

Best,
Rashid

Hi Ronnie,

I’ve already started building a prototype for you. In morning,  I’ll share it with you so you can see how the process will work. Once you review it, we can continue our discussion and refine everything from there.

Best regards,
Rashid

awesome Rashid. im also working on putting together some visuals for you and then ill go ahead and get the project started with you as well. ive decided to work with you. 

im going to put together visuals for: 

- Admin Panel (simple clean interface with a grid of 4 rows of projects, maybe menu navigation to the left and my company logo to the top left. With "+New Project" button. and a "Search" field so we can search for projects. and or maybe "Archive" panel where we can send "Archived" projects after they have been approved. 
- Client Front end Dashboard (showing the grid of all their creative elements in their order)
- Client Single Element proof page (showing the full element they selected along with the "Approve" or "Revision/ Comment" fields. Im thinking perhaps a simple thread of comments. with a "Submit comment" button and a "Forward and Backward" button along with small thumbnails of the other elements that they can also click on to load and provide comments or approval.

Hi Ronnie,

That’s great to hear, and I really appreciate you choosing to move forward with me. The visuals you’re preparing will definitely help us align perfectly on the design and flow.

Your breakdown makes a lot of sense:

Admin Panel with clean grid layout, menu navigation, logo placement, new project button, search, and an archive for approved projects.

Client Dashboard showing all creative elements in their order.

Single Element Proof Page with full view, approve/revision options, threaded comments, submit button, navigation between elements, and thumbnails for quick access.


This is exactly the kind of clarity that ensures we build something smooth and user-friendly for both your team and your clients. Once you share the visuals, I’ll refine the prototype accordingly and keep things moving.

Best regards,
Rashid

Hi Ronnie,

To keep you informed, I’ve been working on a prototype to establish a workflow for the system. Let me know when you have time to jump on a call. I can walk you through what I’ve put together so far and show it, based on what you explained earlier. From there, we can discuss the next steps and start moving forward. I’ve already done quite a bit of work on the flow.

Best
Rashid

Hello Ronnie, 

Just checking if you are available
Hey brother! im up and yes what di dyou have in mind?
Hello, i have created prototype for project loke how functional/actions will be taken in system
If you still around then we can jump on call to see it, or i will upload it on server and send you link and let me know what time is good for you we will catch up at that time
yes feel free to shoot me the link! ill take a look
